instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: SMC_PM_G2 PULSING - 820-4924
threads.message:
[LIST]
[*]PPBUS_G3H                          12.6v
[*]PPDCIN_G3H                         20v
[*]PP3V42_G3H                         3.42v
[*]SMC_RST_L                            3.3
[*]PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMMC     3.3
[*]SMC_BC_ACOK                      3.3
[*]PP3V3_RTC                            3.3
[*]PCH_SRTCRST_L                   3.3
[*]PCH_INTVRMEN_L                3.2
[*]PCH_DSWVRMEN_L              3.2
[*]PCH_CLK32K                         32.768
[*]SMC_BC_ACOK                     3.3
[/LIST]
iSSUE:
[LIST]
[*]SMC_PM_G2                         PULSING  (This is the issue)
[*]PP3V3_S5                              PULSING (This is the issue)
[/LIST]

Any suggestions if its the SMC ?

threads.title: SMC_PM_G2 PULSING - 820-4924
threads.message:
Test what happens in SMC bypass.
Check diode mode to ground on all big coils and other secondary supplies.

threads.title: SMC_PM_G2 PULSING - 820-4924
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 74838, member: 682"]
Test what happens in SMC bypass.
Check diode mode to the ground on all big coils and other secondary supplies.
[/QUOTE]
 
I manage to find the problem and the computer works now. by using the infrared camera. Strange the capacitor was shorted for Audio and pulsing for S_0 state.  Then again, I might have missed checking what state the MacBook was in, I only checked the start-up circuit. see image for the shorted cap!

threads.title: SMC_PM_G2 PULSING - 820-4924
threads.message:
Good job!

Please, do NOT quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.

threads.title: SMC_PM_G2 PULSING - 820-4924
threads.message: Ok... master.. Thank you.. Noted that down :)
